boardgame.name: Las Vegas
Vegas
Vegas Dice Game
拉斯維加斯 Las Vegas
boardgame.description: Developer Stefan Br_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uuml;ck at alea describes Las Vegas as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;an easy, dice-rolling, fun-and-luck game with a lot of interaction and 'schadenfreude'_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. Who doesn't love schadenfreude? (Well, other than those being schadened, I suppose...)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In more detail, Las Vegas includes six cardboard casino mats, one for each side of a normal six-sided die. For each mat, players draw money cards until at least $50k is showing, but the amount may end up being a lot more, making that casino more desirable._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each player has eight dice of a different color, which they take turns rolling. When you roll your dice, you can choose to place them on the relevant casino cards; for example, a die showing a 1 will be placed on the casino mat marked _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;1_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. You must place all dice of one number on one casino in your turn. All players take turns doing this until all the dice have been used. Finally, the player with the most dice on each casino card takes the money associated with it. In case of a tie, the next non-tied player takes the highest-valued money card at that casino._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Las Vegas rates a 1 out of 10 on alea's difficulty scale._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

I am reselling one here to help defray some of my cost of purchase and shipping... so if you are interested let me know. Thanks!
